title: The Client Update Alpha Ending Soon

replies.body:
>  We're currently not planning to bring over the item set creator feature from the legacy client. Basically only an incredibly tiny percentage of players ever used the feature, and we've heard from many players that y'all don't care whether we bring item sets over so long as we continue to support 3rd party item set customization tools like Championify—and we will! 

What ? 

No !
With the customization tool, we can see item without be in-game ! It's important ! 
Please let this. :(
And i don't know if Lol Replay 2 auto item sets stills work...


And you don't speak about ranked teams on new client. Any news ?

Well, you can still customize them using third party tools like Championify—we just don't have any plans to implement the item set builder feature from the old client.

If it turns out that there actually is real demand for that tool, we can reconsider it, of course. But on our great big list of client priorities (implement Replays, spectate, etc.), it would probably fall dead last right now.

Just wanted to give y'all an honest heads up.

I'm very disappointed in this. All I need is one set with all my Support items. It must be a lot of effort to include this feature if I'm being forced to rely on a third party application (which I've never heard of). If this was WoW I'd understand because it's actually normal for people to rely on 3rd party tools, but League has always had a policy of giving everyone everything they need in the base experience.

Hope Championify doesn't get compromised and make me lose my account just because I wanted Oracle's Alteration at the top of my page!

Yeah I second this. I'm also a support main and I rely heavily on my item lists.

The recommended ones are useless for me and why the hell should I _have_ to use a third party site? Not only does it make the game even more inaccessible to new players, it makes League seem like a badly made game. To me, it seems clear that any successful game should have all the tools the player needs within the game-or at least originating from the company that created the game.

My item lists are really detailed, with build options for almost any teamcomp I'd encounter. I'm not interested in redoing those lists, or using another website.

I'm usually happy to adapt to whatever changes Riot makes, but this just feels like a slap in the face. {{item:3151}}

Is Riot's approach really going to be "search for random websites, download files from them, then you'll have custom item sets"? Because that's about as sketchy as selling ice cream from the back of a van with painted windows!

What happened to the philosophy that you shouldn't have to download things from other sites to be on even footing for League? This seems to fly right in the face of that.

If you used the item set maker, I feel your pain. 

But hear us out here: this is ultimately a dev priorities thing. When fewer than 1% of players use a thing, you can safely say it's a lower priority than other things. And there's a TON of features above it on our list—so many that we likely won't get around to it during Open Beta or possibly ever, if people are happy with our support of 3rd-party options.

Again, we're listening to your feedback. We're gonna keep supporting third parties, but if that isn't enough, we'll reconsider.

I can understand from a dev priority and a community usage point why it's being left out. It's business, and it makes good business sense on those grounds.

What *doesn't* make good sense is what it advocates, which is "It's OK to download files or programs from around the web to save you a second or two in game." In this case, a second or two finding items in the shop, but then what's the difference between that and a download that automatically purchases from the shop, or one that automatically rearranged items in your inventory, or types "warded" and blank pings, or one that ward hops for you? 

I can guarantee that if you start telling players that they need to download item sets from other places that there's going to be a rise in third party app usage, not all of which will know about or conform to Riot's policies. All of it will be aimed at "adding functionality that should have been present, but Riot hasn't gotten around to it yet," same as with item set customization. Are you guys ready for that change in League, where third party apps are the norm and expected?

You make good points, but I felt it important to bring up Championify specifically because we  know people like it (we have it installed on a lot of the machines here at Riot). We just want players to know that it'll still work.

The fact that a company that is known for banning people for using 3rd party systems in their game is telling me to use a 3rd party system is very worrying. I use this item system a lot and I'd rather not be banned by your support staff for trying to use it with the new client.

^this, looking at recent reports of people being banned for no reason saying the only thing they were using were voice chat systems makes me even close my browser when I'm in game, now they are telling us to use 3rd party systems 

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}

I will confidently say, we have never banned anyone for using a common or benign third party tool. Championify, Curse Voice, LSI, etc.. these are safe to use and have _never_ caused anyone to be banned. I say this will confidence... it is my job to be right about this.

Anyone who tries to tell you otherwise is either misinformed or outright lying for whatever reason benefits them. I have had _many_ direct conversations with our anti-cheat folks around this topic and have worked very closely with them to ensure their protection of the game does not conflict with our policy of supporting creative community efforts to enhance the player experience in positive ways.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Sargonas,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=xYiHismR,comment-id=00010000000000000001000000000001,timestamp=2016-10-18T21:42:02.619+0000)
>
> I will confidently say, we have never banned anyone for using a common or benign third party tool. 

Great, but how's the average Joe that *doesn't* know Riot's policies on Third Party Apps inside out and backwards (and likely doesn't regularly read the Boards/Reddit) going to treat this? 

Up until now the "safe" rule was "if it's downloaded, don't use it", meaning anything you used via a browser was fine, while anything you downloaded was perceived as significantly more risky. We've seen issues before where a downloaded app will include jungle timers or some other feature that suddenly makes it bannable, even if the player never used said features. Quite frankly, it's this perception (plus the manual effort required by the user) that has kept the Item Sets API from being widely used in the first place. 

If users are downloading other apps than the *one* listed here, it's inevitable we'll see the problems of past downloaded apps come back again, and users *will* get banned for trying to hold onto functionality that Riot's not building into the new Client.

I want my item sets from within the client to still work. I want to be able to make more as I try new champions.

 I don't want to be forced to use 3rd party sites for a game that's supposed to contain everything a player needs to be successful within the game/client itself.

Third party options are not an acceptable alternative and given how risky they can be I don't think it's really fair to ask players to use them. 

If you're not going to bring over item sets then at the very least you need serious overhauls to the recommended item sets and maybe the general in-game shop. Recommended item sets are absolutely woeful.

Custom item sets may be unpopular but for the people who use them they are an absolute lifesaver. Mine ensure I never forget to change trinkets when I need to regardless of role, that I'll always remember options that are quite situational on certain picks and that champions who I build more unusually (i.e. Elise with more AP) can actually be built quickly, without needless searching.

I realise dev priorities are a thing but it's super disappointing to see that this isn't on your radar at all. There aren't many features I'd prioritise above it personally. Custom sets are really really precious to the people who use them.

The reason why its not used is because its messy to use. The feature is great, but it lacks simplicity, sharing features. 

I won't use 3rd party tools with League, I own too many skins to risk being banned, sorry, this isn't good enough.

I agree it's not good enough, but there's an alternative to using third party tools. They document how to do it yourself on the developers site, so you could follow the steps to make your own item sets.


https://developer.riotgames.com/docs/item-sets
Who really has the time to sit through Riot's API's? I don't.  I run a gaming community for League, that's hard enough as it is.

This is also a big concern for me. I like making my own item sets, it helps me keep things organized for my main champs to my preference. With customizable item sets being removed this will cause a great hassle to me. back before item sets were released I had to use word docs or pen/paper to plan out my item builds for my main champs, and I'd rather not be forced to revert to that. If you guys are so adamant about removing item sets from the client, at least add a feature to your website where we can customize our own item sets, so that those who use it will still have a way to do so while not directly interfering with your new client.

As a player that creates item sets for every champion I play, I find this incredibly frustrating. Item sets help me organize and plan out my builds between games, and they reduce the time I spend searching the shop during games. I see no reason to remove them, and I'm very surprised that more players don't use them. They are EXTREMELY helpful, and one of my favorite features that I've seen added to the game. While only a small percentage of players use item sets, the raw number of players that use them is enough that removing them will have a serious impact.

I strongly recommend you put out a poll asking how many players want the feature to stay, rather than assuming no one will care if item sets are removed. Please reevaluate your priorities here before jumping the gun and taking item sets off the to-do list for the new client.

For those of you who rely on 3rd party tools, like Championify or LSI, to add your item sets... _these will still work!_

There is actually a difference, on a technological level, between the Custom Items that are created using the client UI elements, and the custom items that are created by 3rd party tools. The technical underpinnings for those tools will remain (they are related to the core game, not the client) when the client side stuff is phased out.

So what tool would you recommend as an ACTUAL direct replacement for the Item Sets feature? Because I can't find one. Championify isn't even vaguely close, it's just a copy-paste use other peoples' sets tool. LSI looks overweight, focused on other things, and also has complaints about banner ads in what I was able to quickly find.

In short, I see no viable replacement. I need something fairly exactly like what is already built into the old client, and I would have no problem seeing the new client delayed 6 months to get item sets in if that's what it takes. The new client offers nothing of any real interest to me if item sets are missing. Why would I bother with replays if the shop interface is so clumsy and impractical it's not worth trying to play at a higher level of skill anyways?

Definitely not going to be trying the new client if this keeps up, definitely not going to buy RP if item sets stays out, and might quit league altogether if the shop interface has no practical way to buy items of my choice without flipping through a bunch of tabs, scrolling a massive list of mostly things I don't want, or typing in keywords and hoping they match quickly. The backend API is far too userunfriendly to make practical use of by itself, and items are too important to league to be that clumsy to get.

Because this is such a big issue to some of us that Riot currently seems pretty hellbent on ignoring, I'm going to crosslink the other major discussions relevant to this so we can all be on the same page and support eachother with upvotes, comments, etc.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/VIWXPOOA-only-a-tiny-percentage-of-players-use-item-sets-so-we-are-not-bringing-it-to-the-new-client
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/42KFomzO-were-currently-not-planning-to-bring-over-the-item-set-creator-feature-from-the-legacy-client

As of this post (before crosslinking, mere hours after the announcement) they stand at 26, 71, and 43 upvote. This is clearly not a small issue, Riot. Please listen.

Aw Crap, the item set tool is awesome.

Seriously, being able to have all your item in a set order really speeds up the time you spend in the fountain, and I'd rather not download some 3rd party app.

Literally everyone I know uses item sets, the recommended items are junk over half the time, and I know that I, at least, am never going to be able to memorize a build for even ONE champ, let alone every champ I own. I understant that it might be a lot of work, but when I found the custom set function, my games got infinitely better, especially on the champs that I don't play the recommended way. And 3rd party? No thanks, I do NOT want to be banned for trying to use my build, nor do I want viruses.....
!00% agreed.

this.

Like  why remove item sets.
even better, remove the recommended items and keep items sets

Wait.... if by item sets creator you mean the custom item sets tab by our account, it better be carried over to the new client.  I don't want to sound like a privileged ass, but I spend a good 25% of my time in league looking at my item sets.  Half of the fun I have in LOL is from analyzing builds and off-builds and being able to bring that into the game.  If that doesn't get carried over, I would be sorely disappointed.  I was actually about to post a thread on how Item Sets should be more robust, with room for text blocks and more customized organization.  Being forced into the recommended tab would take a lot of the fun out of the game, especially in the off-meta picks I do.

You know... I like to try and remain positive and think optimistically when I see something you all do. After all, you constantly talk about how you want to do what is best for the players and improve the game, and I honestly believe that is your intention. However, I cannot under any circumstance conceive how not carrying over item sets, something everyone from noobs to pros use, is a good idea. 

I use them. 

Every one of my friends use them.

Every streamer and YouTuber I have ever watched uses them. 

This does not sound like a minority. 

Perhaps from a statistical standpoint the users of it are a minority; after all, there are unused accounts and people who haven't even figured out what masteries are by lvl 30. Against that, however, you all also insist that you do not balance around new or low ranked players, but pros and high ranking players who most likely do use this. Let's not forget pros are the minority, so by this idea we should balance for everyone in silver, bronze, and gold and ignore challenger, master, and diamond entirely. They're the minority, right?


This makes no sense by yours or anyone's logic, and to encourage third party software is a cop out at best. Heck, the ones I have seen suggested are TERRIBLE. Championify doesn't allow you to customize to what you want, and it's what you all seem so adamant to support. 

As an alpha tester(with limited time) I did notice the lack of item customization, but I assumed like any logical person that it would be added like in the current client. 


My question in the end is a big "why"? Why is this a good idea? How is this supporting players? How is this helping make games more dynamic and encourage new things? How does this HELP people? 

It does not support player, and takes away a tool that does.

It does not encourage build diversity or dynamic play, and makes it take longer to manage the shop. 

It does not help anyone. Not pros. Not new players. Not anyone in between.



What it does do is piss off everyone and make people question what you guys are thinking even more than they were after smite buffs being removed was announced. I like that you guys are trying new things and doing some cool stuff, but this is nothing shy of bashing players in the face and telling them to screw off. 

This is something, that before you MAKE an announcement on, you NEED to run focus group and ASK players(that are not the internal testing group) what they think, because I can surely tell you that if you asked you would not have such terrible relations issues right now with all the angry people pretty much ready to get the pitchforks and riot(pun intended).


If anything, that last point is what you guys need to work on. Stop making big "we are doing this big and most likely controversial change based solely on what we think is best without even bringing it up to see how people might react and get some ideas on how to improve it" statements. Players LOVE reveals. Players LOVE to feel like they make an impact. So instead of saying "we're doing this", say "we're considering doing this and want thoughts to improve it before we push it out". Even if you decide to stay the course, it makes people feel less backed into a corner and screwed over. I KNOW for a fact nobody would have responded positively to this, but if you had offered it as a possibility and ran some feedback tests you could have avoided this entirely. Heck, send out a thousand email polls for the alpha testers and see what they think, or even make a poll discussion bringing up the item set use. Look at that, player feedback and discussion without pissing everyone and their cousin off. 

Lastly, you need to not make excuses such as "third party exists". Nobody liked that for replays. Nobody likes it now. It is, and always will be, a cop out.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}} 



I will try to remain optimistic as usual, as I am sure the response to this revelation will enlighten you to what players want.

Excellent post. I generally agree with you, and I hope you get enough upvotes to be widely seen. You contributed quite a bit to the discussion in a pretty well-written manner, and I hope the people in charge of the client decisions will take the time to read your post in-full and give it a good thinking-over.
I prefer item sets. I always like the things no one else does... By the end of League's life cycle, everything I like about this game will be taken away because no one else likes it.

Removing item sets?  Please don't Riot.   Please.  I do use them, a lot.  It's great having the individual pieces right there in a line for me for my builds while all my consumables sit at the top.  Everything I want, right there, no scrolling, no muss, no fuss.

Please reconsider and add item sets
Please dont remove the item sets creator!!! We need that !! {{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

I feel like the item sets feature is something that people just don't know about. I feel like if Riot makes it so that more people are informed that it exists, there will be more people using it. It is an amazing feature and I would hate to see it go away. PLZ RIOT! Keep the item sets in the game

my ITEM SETS will transfer from the current client to the new alpha one right? RIGHT? Because I spent a fair amount of time making sets for a lot of my champions and do NOT want to redo the process (◕╭╮◕) Rito plz, dispel my worries

As someone who thought using third party apps was bannable, having them recommended is... confusing.
 {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}

Using a 3rd party tool _"that gives a measurable unfair advantage"_ is bannable.. by that specific wording what we mean to say is "using hacks/cheats/scripts" will get you banned.

Tools like Curse Voice, Overwolf, Championify, LSI, lolreplay, etc however will *not* get you banned, _ever_. At first glance it may sound a bit tricky to gain the burden of knowledge to tell the difference, but in reality if you stop and actually look at the applications in question it's pretty obvious and straightforward right away if an app is giving you an unfair advantage, or if it's something like Championify or Curse voice.

Even with those "legal" applications, we already know that Riot cannot actually give them absolute approval because Riot is not responsible for changes to them. They may change later and become illegal, or they may become compromised; the risk is always on us as the user, and it doesn't feel good to hear that Riot is willing to let us take that risk.

https://cdn.meme.am/instances/500x/72513409.jpg

Even if the item sets aren't very popular, they're really important to some people (especially support mains). It saves me a lot of time when I use the custom item sets instead of having to search for things that I need. I basically have an item set for all the champions that I frequently play, and I really don't want to use a third party system when I really shouldn't have to.

Was assuming we'd get an actually-useful itemset builder since you went to the effort of building a new client and all. Now I'm thoroughly disappointed.

Seriously, there was so much potential. Could build out a system where you can design back timings basically, where you get the "event" popups for back timings for new builds, new champ, new players. Could let the community build these out aggressively per-matchup, per-playstyle, per-person. Would help everyone from new players to veterans.

are there any benefits for the alpha testers?
{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}
What do you want, an icon? I don't think Riot would give rewards just for testing the client.
OR WOULD WE HUEHUEHUEHUE

SUCH BS, OUT OF ALL THE STUFF RIOT'S BEEN DOING THIS IS ONE OF THOSE THAT ARE WAY TOO FAR. I HAVE LIKE 30 SETS...even if I could be playing league way more if I had the time these days It would STILL be hard to remember how multiple builds go for even just my top 5 champs on the spot when shopping...This is so stupid I will be limited to building worse now as I can't waste time at base esp in ranked whenever I will do some of it

i was really excited by this article. i cant wait to see the new client, and have less bugs everywhere.

...

and then i get to the end, and read this bullshit about custom item sets not being used by enough players to matter... and then a suggestion to use a 3rd party program in lieu of custom item sets, when riot has BANNED so many people for using 3rd party programs (~~sometimes, not even related to the actual client, just outside programs used to talk with teammates~~)

Really not making yourself look good here, riot. You've  said that you dont want players to have need 3rd party programs to play league, and indirectly insulted other game companies for doing so, and now you are advocating the use of one because one feature isnt important enough to include in the new client?  Really bad form, riot.

Items are CRUCIAL to the game. You cannot win without them. Itemization is incredibly important. Its the difference between winning and losing every game.  Using a recommended item set to play is not going to get the win every game. There is only so much you can do with recommended or uploaded item sets.

Also, i thought riot wanted the game to be LESS "optimal builds are OP so everyone will use them" and more "there is more than one way to play this champ"?  Isnt removing the item set creator from the game moving in the **opposite** direction from this? 

This just seems to be extremely opposed to the narrative riot has laid out so far.  If the custom item sets issue is ignored by riot, i will be extremely disappointed in them.  I have thought that they **arent **all about making money from people, and disregarding whatever doesnt make the most money.  This would cause me to believe they arent as interested in making a fun game as they have claimed. I hope they realize the importance of this decision.

I really, really want the item set creation feature kept or a fully equivalent very well supported open source 3rd party alternative that Riot actively and explicitly works with to ensure it's always current and usable.

This feature is far more important to me than you seem to think, and I'm pretty sure I'm not alone here! I need that feature or a full, always-usable equivalent. It can't be something that ends up unusable sometimes when the game is patched, etc. It's that important.

I encourage everyone who feels the same way to upvote relevant topics on the forums, comment here, email Riot, etc, whatever it takes to make our voices heard. This is no small issue to me!

> [{quoted}](name=The Last Zica,realm=NA,application-id=2E4zVIwd,discussion-id=xYiHismR,comment-id=0013,timestamp=2016-10-18T20:18:19.979+0000)
>
> I really, really want the item set creation feature kept or a fully equivalent very well supported open source 3rd party alternative that Riot actively and explicitly works with to ensure it's always current and usable.
> 

I agree too

championify looks terribly bloated and slightly dodgy

RIOT

Since you discontinue the creation of item sets in the client, will we be able to keep using the item sets we already created in the old client? These sets are stored currently in the appropriate champion folders in  RIOT_ItemSet_X.json files. Will these files be still available and usable, or will they be deleted? Championify creates similar files (except no RIOT in the name) so I am assuming that you will keep those champion folders, so the Championify files can be stored. Anyway, I would suggest anyone who is using itemsets, to back them up before the client update. They can be modified by a text editor if necessary to be compatible with the new client (similar to Championify files). You just no longer will be able to modify them in the client. 

Another question to RIOT. Will you be able to release the source code for the Item Set Generator, so someone could create a stand alone item set generator for the general public? I am not into APIs, but I believe there are some competent people out there. Last year, I believe there was an API for this reason, but that does not seem to be updated. Maybe RIOT could support that API as a stand alone tool, so we could still generate custom item sets.

You are supposed to go to battle fully prepared. With your runes, masteries and weapons (item sets).

Thanks
Wait what, Item set creator is going away?  So then is this third party thing already in/ready to use for alpha, or what... I am one of the few that did do this on characters/lanes.
